com.mesosphere.sdk.offer

Class CommonTaskUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.CommonTaskUtils

  • public class CommonTaskUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Various utility methods for manipulating data in TaskInfos.

      • toTaskName

        public static java.lang.String toTaskName(TaskID taskId)
                                   throws TaskException
        Converts the unique TaskID into a Framework defined task name.

        For example: "instance-0__aoeu5678" => "instance-0"

        Throws:
        TaskException

      • toTaskId

        public static TaskID toTaskId(java.lang.String taskName)
        Converts the Framework defined task name into a unique TaskID.

        For example: "instance-0" => "instance-0__aoeu5678"

        Throws:
        TaskException - if the index data wasn't found

      • getTargetConfiguration

        public static java.util.UUID getTargetConfiguration(TaskInfo taskInfo)
                                             throws TaskException
        Returns the ID referencing a configuration in a ConfigStore associated with the provided TaskInfo.
        Parameters:
        taskInfo - is the TaskInfo from which the the configuration ID will be extracted.
        Returns:
        the ID of the target configuration for the provided TaskInfo
        Throws:
        TaskException - when a TaskInfo is provided which does not contain a Label with an indicated target configuration

      • readinessCheckSucceeded

        public static boolean readinessCheckSucceeded(TaskInfo taskInfo,
                                              TaskStatus taskStatus)
        Returns whether or not a readiness check succeeded. If the indicated TaskInfo does not have a readiness check, then this method indicates that the readiness check has passed. Otherwise failures to parse readiness checks are interpreted as readiness check failures. If some value other than "true" is present in the readiness check label of the TaskStatus, the readiness check has failed.
        Parameters:
        taskInfo - A TaskInfo which may or may not have a readiness check defined.
        taskStatus - A TaskStatus which may or may not contain a readiness check label.
        Returns:
        the result of a readiness check for the indicated TaskInfo and TaskStatus.

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fromEnvironmentToMap(Environment environment)
        Extracts the environment variables given in the Environment.
        Parameters:
        environment - The Environment to extract environment variables from
        Returns:
        The map containing environment variables

        Extracts and puts environment variables from the given map to a Environment.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • packTaskInfo

        public static TaskInfo packTaskInfo(TaskInfo taskInfo)
        Mesos requirements do not allow a TaskInfo to simultaneously have a Command and Executor. In order to workaround this we encapsulate a TaskInfo's Command field in an ExecutorInfo and store it in the data field of the TaskInfo. Unpacked: - taskInfo - executor - data: custom - command Packed: - taskInfo - executor - data: serialized executorinfo - data: custom - command
        See Also:
        unpackTaskInfo(TaskInfo)

      • unpackTaskInfo

        public static TaskInfo unpackTaskInfo(TaskInfo taskInfo)
        This method reverses the work done in packTaskInfo(TaskInfo) such that the original TaskInfo is regenerated. If the provided TaskInfo doesn't appear to have packed data then this operation does nothing. TODO(nickbp): Make this function only visible to Custom Executor code. Scheduler shouldn't ever call it.
        See Also:
        packTaskInfo(TaskInfo)

      • getProcess

        public static java.lang.ProcessBuilder getProcess(TaskInfo taskInfo)

                                          java.lang.String labelKey,
                                          java.lang.String labelValue)

        Returns:
        an updated Labels.Builder with the requested label
